page.title: 06EDUCATION IN CHRISTLETON
page.content: Children under 5 attend Mother and Toddler or Playgroup in each village. At 5yrs of age they attend Waverton or Christleton Primary Schools. At 11yrs most transfer to Christleton High which caters for pupils from a wide area around the villages. There are 1000 pupils at the school which has a fine academic record in addition to excellence in Creative arts and crafts music,drama and sport.A small number of children leave school at 16, whilst others stay on to study at an advanced level and hope to qualify for College or University. There is much teenage unemployment at present but most Christleton pupils are able to find jobs. Adult Education takes place each evening at the High School.The village also has a College of Law where 850 students study for qualifications for a career in the Legal Profession.
